Reviews.Title: “good value for central rome”
Reviews.Author: Jan B
Reviews.Content: Easy to reach - take 38 bus from Termini, bus stop 3, Piazza Fiume. We had room 402 which had a small balcony so we could watch the locals go about their business which was great. It was our first visit to Rome and it just blew us away!!! We bought a Roma Pass for 30 euros and it more than paid for itself - we got free entry to Colisseum and Forum cutting out the queues and hopped on an off buses and trains at will. We booked a Vatican tour online from the Vatican website in advance and it was good value. Note - if you go to St Pietro's Basillica on a Wed morning by about 10.30am you can see the Pope! We were about 6 feet away - just amazing and totally unexpected - the highlight of a great break.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - Location OK”
Reviews.Author: MJVADC
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel. The rooms are lovely – ours had a balcony and we spent one evening have a some wine and cheese while reflecting on our day. The staff is friendly and the breakfast was very good. The only drawback was the location. It was a 5 minute walk from the Borghese Gallery, but a cab or bus is required to get to the other attractions in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Location is a thumbs up”
Reviews.Author: naughtb4
Reviews.Content: Nice Hotel, nice location and does a very good job of being a base to explore rome, its not perfect bu its rme, why stay in the hotel :)

Reviews.Title: “A well placed Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Barbara K
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Rome in October 2011. The hotel was ideally situated for us, near to a small supermarket, cellular shop, bus stops and a metro sation less than a kilometer away. We were also in walking distance of the Galleria Borghese. We were also just a five minute taxi ride from the Termini Stazione and a 15 minute taxi ride from the Vatican. There were also lots of little restaurants in the immediate area. The hotel room itself was tidy with its own bathroom and the service was good. Our room which was a double overlooked a side street. My sisters single room overlooked the gardens of the buildings next door and had a small balcony that proved to be very useful for evening snacks and a glass of wine. There was a full breakfast available. The reception staff were very helpful, going out of their way to help us ensure a visit to the Galleria Borghese for which we had not booked. There is the tiniest elevator, taking just two people at a time, if you're not claustrophobic it's OK, if you are just close your eyes or use the stairs if you are able. The only down factor was the smell of sewerage outside the rooms, especially on the 3rd floor. Fortunately this did not come into the rooms. The cost of 2 people for 4 nights in October 2011 cost us 600 Euros which we thought was very reasonable. There was an extra levy per day that had to be paid over and above the cost of the hotel. There was a sign in the lift informing us of this additional cost.

Reviews.Title: “awful”
Reviews.Author: PNINA_P
Reviews.Content: for a short stay in Rome i though the Executive will be a good, low cost option. This hotel is supposed to be 4 stars could be barely 2. The staff is polite but not friendly, our room 404 was horrible with empty snaks under the beds (none cleans under the beds?), stains on the curtains and the carpet. very dark, not enough light, no mirrors and even not a simple decoration! just poor! no curtain on the shower so all the bathroom becomes a swimming pool... the breakfast is very basic and location - not the best... about 15 mins walk from Via Veneto. no shops or restaurants nearby. free wi-fi only in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “thank u terry.problem with the beard guy”
Reviews.Author: Michael K
Reviews.Content: i must to say thanks to reception man terry. he waz wery helpfull and nice, he makes this hotel very good.without him at will be just average. on another side there is one beard reception guy realy dont remember his name very nervous and angry on something all the time. if u dont like u job go find another one !!! anyway nice and clean hotel.

Reviews.Title: “NOT 4 star”
Reviews.Author: SamanthaDina
Reviews.Content: In our room the shower fixture was broken so that the shower head could not be held up and the floor did not drain. Exposed wires were hanging out of the wall in the room. The decor was generally cheap and not in good condition. The room faced the street and was quite noisy. Every mirror in the lobby bathroom is smashed. There is no lighting in the stairway and the lifts are unreliable. The concierge wanted to keep our passports for the duration of our stay and room keys everytime we left the hotel. I have stayed in nicer hostels.

Reviews.Title: “Strange 4 stars???”
Reviews.Author: anachtistav
Reviews.Content: This hotel according to European standards isn't even a 2 star hotel, let alone 4 stars. It might have been a 4 star hotel decades ago. Apart from the shabby, tiny, poorly furnished and equipped rooms and bathrooms the carpets and sofas don't seem clean. The breakfast is very poor. The staff was friendly, that is the best we can say about this said to be 4 star hotel! How can this hotel be classified as 4 stars? Only to mislead guests and to cash. There were other guests at the hotel that shared our views. We have photos that prove this. The lifts are something unseen! There aren't any facilities for handicapped people as per European regulations and norms. This is not acceptable. It is not worth what is charged.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: cathy h
Reviews.Content: it is a pleasant hotel in a good location. you can walk to historical center, but the neighborhood is non-touristy. many others in the hotel appeared to be Italian business travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Executive, Rome Italy”
Reviews.Author: windandsand
Reviews.Content: Arrived in Rome October 1, 2011 and stayed one night at the Hotel Executive in Rome Italy. Small hotel on a side street. Front desk had maps and they were able to show us how to get to the subway to travel to the Colluseum. Breakfast was very good. Rooms were a decent size and clean. You have to take about 8 stairs down to the small main lobby and elevator fits one person with a suitcase. They recommended a glutten free restaurant within walking distance that was very good. You can take the bus or walk to the old area of Rome from this hotel. It is a good walk. A bit far from the Colluseum so we took the subway. The next day public transit was on strike, traffic was a mess so we were happy we paid for the transfer to the cruise ship. We talked to some people who stayed near the Terminus so they were able to walk across the street to take the train to the cruise dock. Luckily it was only the city transportation on strike that day. We were able to walk all around the city, over to the Vatican and back to the hotel, good exercise and a nice long walk. Free wifi in the lobby. No complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4 Star hotel”
Reviews.Author: scuba312
Reviews.Content: the good: Hotel lobby, breakfast room and rooms we stayed in were clean. The staff were competent and helpful with sightseeing advice and checking on tour and bus transfer pick ups at hotel. Room had balcony facing street. Cold breakfast was good start to day with cereals, fruit, boiled eggs, cheese slices, sliced meats, pastries and fresh pot of coffee and heated milk. Location good for seeing Villa Bhorgese, Trevi fountain and Via Veneto shops. The bad: Balcony, halls and stairwells needed cleaning and painting. Carpets in halls need replacement since looked shabby, dusty and stained. TV was a joke since so small it would barely be put in a kid's bedroom. Only CNN and BNN were English language. Hotel really needs a total makeover to rate a 4 star.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and cleanliness.”
Reviews.Author: tocororo83
Reviews.Content: Great service, continental breakfast and cleanliness.

Reviews.Title: “will never return”
Reviews.Author: sara e
Reviews.Content: We just came back from this hotel. I have never felt compelled to write about any hotel because I beleive you get what you pay for. This hotel was good value for it's location and room size (we were three in a room) However, the wi fi did not work in the room, the TV was of poor quality and the breakfast was not fresh. Non of this would have mattered so much if the front desk personell would have been helpful and curtious. They were rude, condensending and unfriendly. Loved Rome, disliked the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “basic, quiet”
Reviews.Author: ermanno024
Reviews.Content: we stayed at this hotel as part of our package tour of Italy. 2 nights at the begining of our trip and one night 2 weeks later. our first room was very basic, clean bed and shower nothing fancy. the room we had at the end of our trip was much nicer with a large private terrace with a table and chairs, it was room # 601. I would recomend this room for you. the hotel is in a quiet area just north of all of Rome's attractions..I dont know the cost of the room because it was included in our tour but I do know the rooms in downtown Rome are not cheap...remember, your in Rome, not Hooterville. have a great trip!

Reviews.Title: “Putting 4 stars on the hotel sign does not make it a 4 star hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Canadntrvler
Reviews.Content: The good: Location was close to a transportation and taxi stand. There were some nice restaurants nearby and it was an easy walk to the Borgese Gardens. It was a good price. Nice cappicino with breakfast. The bad: The continential breakfast left lots to be desired. There was little selection, the food was poor quality and only slight changes day to day. There was no computer access unless you brought your own. The staff were very reluctant to assist with booking tickets online and it felt like you were bothering them if you asked for any suggestions or directions for sightseeing or eating. The room had few ammenities for a four star. Very basic furnishings and a worn out grungy feel. Not at all a place you'd like to hang out. The ugly: The room stank - literally. At first we thought they had just cleaned the carpets and it would go away but the smell never did. We had to plug our noses when we entered the room and run to open the window before we could adjust. It was literally gagging after a day of being closed up. Couldn't decide what the cause was. Even our clean clothes had to be washed when we got home as the smell had penetrated our suitcases. There was black mould all along the tub, goop splashed along the wall and everything felt grungy. The wool blanket between the sheets looked like it was never washed. The basics were cleaned everyday and you can tell the staff worked hard but the maintainance of the hotel was sadly lacking. Sort of like an old hooker. From a distance it looks great - but up close it tells a different story. If you are looking for a place to stay at a decent price it does the trick. Just don't believe the advertising - unless the ratings are out of 8 - this is not a 4 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel; convenient location for tourists.”
Reviews.Author: CharlesRJ
Reviews.Content: For a two-night stay to see the sights of Rome, this proved a very suitable hotel. We walked to it from Termini station in about 25 minutes so shouldn’t have been too expensive a taxi ride for those preferring to use one. It’s a convenient location for tourists with Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain etc. also within walking distance. It’s also a relatively short walk from the nearest stop of the Ciao open top bus tour route, which we found to be a very good way to get around the key attractions including Colosseum and Vatican in a day. Hotel reception has leaflets for this and similar tours. Reception staff were friendly and helpful, giving useful advice. Dining room offers a basic but adequate buffet breakfast but no other meals. Rooms were clean and comfortable with hairdryer, soaps, shampoos etc. in the bathrooms. One of our rooms had a balcony but from the outside, I don’t think there are many so guess we were lucky. However, it wasn’t the type of holiday where we made great use of it anyway. There are seven floors and the two lifts can only really accommodate two people each. Being on the second floor, it was easier just to go up the stairs. As my job includes teaching Fire Marshal courses, I wasn’t too happy about the way they sometimes have laundry baskets in what is their fire exit staircase. We could get past them OK in normal use but with 100 people staying, they should make better effort to keep them clear in case of emergency. If you like pizza, there is a restaurant called Pepe Nero two streets away and the hotel recommended it to us. We thought the food and service there was fantastic and we’d recommend it to anyone who likes that sort of place. Reasonable value but we’d pass on the coffee another time – there was only about an egg cup full and it was extremely strong! Everything else had been so good we just laughed that off. There are plenty of other restaurants within walking distance if you prefer something different.

Reviews.Title: “Seriously needs a refurbishment”
Reviews.Author: Sagittarius09
Reviews.Content: When we first stayed at this hotel we enjoyed the experience so much that we went back again, but we were disappointed and probably won't go back. The front desk staff were not particularly friendly or helpful during our stay in 2010. The rooms are looking very tatty and the beds need to be replaced. The bathroom wasn't very clean either. It is a shame as the location is fabulous and the rates were reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Good accomodation although slightly outside of main central Rome”
Reviews.Author: HHolland
Reviews.Content: nice hotel, with a lovely breakfast. It is slightly out if the centre of Rome however if your happy to use the local buses (€4 per day for all bus and metro) then this hotel is good. On a quiet side street so NO noise from anything which is unusual in a city. All in all a nice pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here, you can do better in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Colie
Reviews.Content: It's not a 4 star hotel, not sure how it got that rating! We stayed here twice with our tour group. Our first room was dark, dingy, air did not work well, noisy fan, dirty carpets, mouldly bathtub, no bath towels (yes once requested they did bring them). The bedsheets were clean but the room was in total disrepair. The TV was so small that you really couldn't see it from the bed. The breakfast surprisingly was okay - fresh juices, croissants, lunch meat ham, sliced cheese, boiled eggs. The staff were disinterested and certainly not service oriented. We complained upon arrival about the a/c and the noisy fan, requesting that we get another room but they told us that it was not necessary and sent up a fellow who couldn't speak English, basically indicating that that's what the a/c fan sounded like and to turn it off if it was too noisy. It was a depressing room, thankfully for us we had arrived in Rome three days prior and stayed at a lovely day (see my review for Best Western Hotel Canada) otherwise we would have been totally turned off Rome Hotels. Our last night our tour group returned late and the hotel gave us one of their best rooms. So it appears that they do listen -- Yes it was bigger, with a balcony, yes the a/c worked, and yes they listened to our previous complaints but it's the details, broken mirrors, water stained plaster, that make this hotel more a hostel than hotel. Honestly, one could do better and I would never recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “On checking out they were right not to ask "How was your stay?"”
Reviews.Author: Fred052011
Reviews.Content: Hotel looked pleasant from outside. Checked in and got into the smallest lift I've ever seen. Once we got to the room we were really disappointed. We didn't care about the size but it was in a state of disrepair and not fit for guests. The bed was clean but there were stains on the walls and carpets. The air vents were hanging out from the ceiling. The shower tray was cracked and water was seeping through the floor and onto carpet beside the bed. There was a square of plaster on the wall which must have been an attempt to cover it. Television was really small too. The bed clothes were not changed during our 4 night stay and the toiletries weren't replenished after the first night. i can honestly say I have never seen such a hotel room and would advise anyone thinking of going here to stay away. We were not asked how our stay was and I can only imagine that they must have known what the answer would be. Don't go!

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant base for our Rome mini-vacation”
Reviews.Author: PRSV
Reviews.Content: My partner and I spent one night at this hotel. I can't really comment on price as we bought a combined flight/hotel/airport transfer deal. We arrived at about 9.30 in the morning and we're given our room straight away. The room was fairly small but spotlessly clean. The bathroom was fine, the only thing missing was a shower curtain. Breakfast was pleasant with a choice of cheese, meat, yoghurts, cereals / muesli,... We asked for coffee and got quite reasonable (not great) cups. On the second day we checked out at 11:00 am, but they happily let us leave our bags there until 7:00 pm when the minibus for our deal picked us up to go to the airport. I agree that this should probably be considered a 3-star hotel, but if you're looking for someone clean, safe and pleasant for your stay in Rome you shouldn't have any hesitation about staying here. It's about a ten minute walk from the hotel to the nearest Metro station.

Reviews.Title: “Not British 4 star but clean and tidy and friendly”
Reviews.Author: Tommyt1958
Reviews.Content: This hotel describes itself as 4 star it is not. However it is clean and tidy and only a 10 minute walk from the main bus and train termini. The room was clean if a little small with very limited hanging space.The bed was comfortable. The bathroom was ok shower could have been bigger found it easier to dry ourselves in the main bedroom. Ther is a busy road close by which we could hear also a building site next door though it appears to be close to being finished. The biggest problem was the poor air condition it actually made the room warmer and made for a hot night.Would have been unbearable in the summer. Other reports mention the lifts.These are small and hold only 4 people you need to be friendly with other lift users.The lifst are tiny... This hotel is fine for a weekend and we spent very little time at the hotel as there isn't really a bar though you can get a drink in lounge/dinning area Breakfast is continental though there was plenty to eat. Eating- we found close by just off the main through road a fantastic pizzeria called Napoli pizzeria get in before 8 as the local romans and their famlies eat at this time it became full quickly and a queue formed outside for tables a good sign we thought. A meal for four with drinks 100 to115 euros. Highly reccomended.

Reviews.Title: “did not stay due to the smell of raw sewage in the corridor”
Reviews.Author: citygirl018
Reviews.Content: booked via the BA website. Thought that the lift was a bit cramped on way up to the 3rd floor. As we got out of the 3rd floor there was the unmistakeable smell of raw sewage. The room we were shown to was tired with stains on the carpet and thin blankets on the bed. We decided not to stay, found alternative accomodation and checked out. this is not a 4 star establishment.

Reviews.Title: “NOT A FOUR STARS HOTEL AS ADVERTISED, NOT VALUE FOR MONEY”
Reviews.Author: kikki083
Reviews.Content: Last week, I was on leisure trip in Rome and had the worst hotel experience of my life with the 2 nights I spent in Hotel Executive in Rome. The room looked old, tired, all the tapestry on the walls scratched in some areas and dirty, needed absolute refreshing and painting. Furniture was old and needed absolute replacement and there was a terrible and strong smell of sheet, waste both in the room and the hallways. When informed the Front Desk staff, he simply recognized the fact by a sign of his head and did not even express any apology. While I was in the room, I dropped a small bottle of water on the floor which went down the bed. The other day, the bottle was still there. While looking for some information after the check-in, I heard the Receptionist confirming to some guests on the day of their departure that the check-out time was the latest at noon whereas when I went to pay for my bill the next day another Front Desk staff in an aggressive manner underligned the fact that the check-out time was 11:00 o'clock and that that was the practive in all hotels in Rome. This is of course a lie since I spent some nights before in Rome again in a 5 stars hotel of a well-know brand where the check-out time is noon. All in all, I'll never recommend this hotel to anybody. For both it's customer service, condition of the rooms and public areas and way of dealing with a customer, I'll not give more than 2 stars to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Simply not a four star hotel”
Reviews.Author: cleftydave
Reviews.Content: Hotel executive has none of the hall marks of a four star hotel, other than the price. The rooms are small and very old fashioned without any character. The bed (nearly new mattress) wasn't particularly comfortable. The AC was noisy. The tv was tiny with barely any tuned channels, nothing in English at all. Bathroom was small, clean and nondescript. Next door there is building work with hammering starting at 8 in the morning. Breakfast was a choice of fruit, bad stale pasteries, rubber cheese and wallpaper ham. Nothing about this place suggested any thing more than a two star hotel. From the early nineties.

Reviews.Title: “friendly but not a 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: mary198610
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for 4 nights last may.The staff was friendly and helpful but that was almost all!!It was too expensive for what it offered and my friends' room smelled like a basement.The location was good but again not a 4star!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Expected the worst after reading the reviews...but was pleasantly surprised!”
Reviews.Author: donnab007
Reviews.Content: My husband booked this hotel as it was suggested via Trailfinders. I had some concerns after reading the reviews on this site and went there expecting the worst. However, we were pleasantly surprised by our stay. There are a few things that have been said that I agree with namely the lift, it is certainly not for the claustraphobic, we travelled with a 7 month old baby and struggled to get the buggy in there. The bathroom could also benefit from having a shower curtain! The TV's could also do with being updated. The room was a good size as was the bathroom. It was clean and the bed was very comfortable. The continental breakfast was very good with plenty of choice from cold meat, cheese, eggs, cereals, breads, yogurts and fruit. The staff were very helpful and pleasant. In terms of its location, the hotel isn't in the hub of things but we found the immediate area very nice, with some fantastic restaurants. It is a walk to the main attractions and sights. However, the hotel supplied us with a map of the area which we actually used instead of the AA one we had purchased as it showed much greater detail. We decided to walk everywhere as it was the perfect way to take in all the beautiful sights along the way. Alternatively, the Metro is very easy to use and taxi's are not overly expensive. All in all we had a wonderful time in Rome and would have no problem with staying at the Hotel Executive again.

Reviews.Title: “Not 4 star!”
Reviews.Author: ObanMorf
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with a group of friends for 5 nights. Booked this through BA holidays and this hotel is advertised as a 4 star...not 4 stars...2 or 3 stars! Downsides- Bedrooms very, very small and bathrooms tiny....lifts (an experience!)...poor facilities in the rooms ie nowhere to put clothes away, no mirrors, nowhere to put toileteries...no reall comfortable reception area or bar! Good 30 min walk to the Trevi Fountain so pretty far out of the centre! Upsides- it was clean and we had clean bedding and towels each day.....good continential breakfast with plenty of choice...helpful staff. If you book this and expect it to be 4star UK standard then you will be disappointed but if you think of it as a 3star then it is quite acceptable. Probably would not rush back though as it is just too far out of the centre of Rome for walking each day!

Reviews.Title: “2 Star NOT 4 Star”
Reviews.Author: Tjay100
Reviews.Content: Whenever I read a bad report about a hotel, I say one of two things: either the report has been maliciously written by a rival hotel OR written by someone who is a born complainer, you know the person I mean, the one who complains that the night light was 15 Watts instead of 25 Watts!!! Well let me reassure you that I am neither of the above. I will however present my very first negative hotel review. I feel the need to write this because of my obligation to humanity. I decided to surprise my wife with a trip to Rome. The travel agent assured me the hotel would be a 4 star rating. To be fair to the agent, he had never been there. Let me start of by saying that my stay at the Hotel Executive in Rome, was my WORST experience EVER. They rate it as four stars, I would be generous (or even lying) if I gave it 2. The room smelt of wet socks. The bed was a King size, which was a bonus because we had to share it with bugs the size of full grown adults. I got bitten four times after which I decided to sleep in my jeans. Ever tried sleeping in jeans on a romantic weekend?? They said there was a balcony with a view. Ever tried staying in a room where the only view you had was of a lift generator, water tank and two half dead pigeons. The lifts took forever to travel the 7 floors to our room. I managed to get a little routine going, I would call the lift BEFORE I went into the make-shift shower, that way it would arrive just after I got dressed 10 minutes later!! The 14inch TV (which was about 10 years old) was placed on a stool. The settee had stains on it which I don't really want to go into right now, or ever!! The carpet was alive, yes alive. Must be the dwelling place for the bugs that couldn't fit on the bed. The bathroom was so scary. It was a traumatic ordeal contemplating using it. We didn't drink or eat much so that we could limit the time we needed to visit the loo. Let me conclude by saying this PLEASE PLEASE PLEASE do not stay at the Hotel Executive in Rome. YOU WILL REGRET IT…

Reviews.Title: “A clean hotel with helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: John27CC
Reviews.Content: Everything was fine, clean rooms albeit small, a nice balcony to sit out on. Helpful staff, breakfast was usual european. Location was ok. Was it 4*? not sure, but I would gladly use it again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly adequate”
Reviews.Author: amaismy
Reviews.Content: The staff were friendly and helpful. The room was clean and comfortable. The breakfast was fine. We walked comfortably to Spanish Steps and Trevi Fountain and there abouts. Little far from metro when coming back at night but taxis are always an option.

Reviews.Title: “Clean rooms but not very helpful receptionists”
Reviews.Author: vasso83
Reviews.Content: Executive hotel is almost at the center of Rome. The room was clean and luxurious, but smaller than the pictures depicted on the internet. The receptionists were quite helpful, as once we asked for a restaurant and they proposed one that wasn't open!

Reviews.Title: “Great Time , Will Be Back”
Reviews.Author: jetsetgeorgie
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this Hotel on 3rd floor, Yes there was a smell when you got out of lift. You can get this anywhere were you stay at Home or Away get real. Room was good no damage or smell in bathroom, it was nice and clean and tidy, Bed was great. Out of Hotel at 9.30am to see sites and back late. I checked the reviews and first thought the worst. Its not realy that bad only if you stayed inside and not went out siteseeing. It is close, yes if you like waking I must say that I enjoyed walking every day and seeing the sites . At the back of the Hotel there is building site not realy a problem. As you should be out taking in the sites. When you recived your room key you were given a map and shown where the hotel was if you got lost well done. Hotel staff were great and I will be back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “HORRIFIC”
Reviews.Author: colombo123
Reviews.Content: Rating this hote four star has caused me to lose faith in the rating system. Abest it is a 1.5 star venue.The elevators were accurately described by previous reviewers. once on the room floor we were hit with the odor of raw sewage. The room was incredibly tiny and dingy. Not even a shower curtain in the bathroom. The place is depressing, in a lousy location. You could do much better. Do not stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Just don't stay there.”
Reviews.Author: ptog
Reviews.Content: I really don't know. I guess the owner of this hotel is Berlusconi’s friend, maybe that explains how they name this hotel a 4 star! The bad things started even before I get to Rome. Two days before my arrival I've sent them an e-mail asking for directions from the airport to the hotel. Their answer was "take a taxi or the train". Not so helpful isn't. Anyway, I stayed at the 4th floor and there was a bad smell in the whole place. In my tiny room there was a wall really close to the bed with mildew, in fact everything in the room was falling apart. Outside the elevator there was a (strange) heavy second door with no stopping mechanism so everytime someone was getting in or out of the elevator you can hear in your room the noise that was made. The breakfast was poor and bad. No pc in the hotel. Not really close to the centre (you have to take a taxi several times) and of course ridiculously expensive (it's a 4 star after all). So here is my advice. Avoid this hotel even if it has the last free room in Rome. Prefer to stay in a 2 star where you can have the same things for less money.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected.”
Reviews.Author: scenicgrandmom
Reviews.Content: Hotel was not in close proximity to city of Rome. We had to take bus to Termini and find our way from there. We did take the Metro a few times and enjoyed the short rides. The hotel staff was good, especially Roberto, and the continental breakfast was very good. Plenty of fresh fruit, cereals, oatmeal, yogurts, ham, cheese, breakfast rolls and better than expected American coffee. Room was avg size for Europe, no closets, no drawers, and very harsh lighting that could not be controlled by individual setting. Bathroom showed signs of some mildew around shower door, but overall it was very well maintained and bright. Beds & pillows firmer than I like, but if tired you make do.

Reviews.Title: “Budget Hotel - Clean - reasonable location”
Reviews.Author: vrodder
Reviews.Content: We had one of the few rooms with a balcony which was a plus. The room was adequate, no complaints about cleanliness and was always clean and tidy when we got back. Plenty of bathroom soaps etc... Shower was good and hot. Room got stuffy and with door open onto balcony was noisy. Musty smell in the corridor. Breakfast was basic but ok. Not bad for a city centre hotel for about £50 a day but you wouldn't want to pay much more and you wouldn't want a long stay there. Can walk to most sights from the hotel, Termini is about a 20 min walk. Recommend La Cantinola Ristorante on 16-18 Via Calabria for some good value eating.

Reviews.Title: “DEFINETLY NOT 4* however”
Reviews.Author: martina98
Reviews.Content: It was clean. The hotel may have many floors but the reception and breakfast room are small. The bedrooms too are small and basic but clean towels and sheets every day. So can't fault that. The breakfast is very basic - okay if you just like cold cuts and yougurt (exactly the same every day). I expected to find a bar (as stated in description). The bar area is a few shelves in the corner of the breakfast room with two settees. That was very disappointing as we like a nightcap. However still had that in the bedroom. Our room on the 6th floor overlooked a building site and was close to the main road (very noisy). I would say that this was a 2-3* hotel. Definetly go back to Rome but definetely not to the Executive.

Reviews.Title: “What an executive treatment”
Reviews.Author: Arxana
Reviews.Content: As the name suggested,The hotel was very elegant in its way.The person at the reception used to change everyday but they were very polite and helpful.The rooms though were not huge but had facilities of a 4 star hotel.The room service was also very good.The bathrooms were very small but manageable.A good place to stay n relax.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here”
Reviews.Author: HHCLondon
Reviews.Content: Room small. TV connection awful. Bathroom small - no shower curtain. Water fell on the floor and made an awful mess. Lifts SOOOO small! And SOOOOO slow! Room smelt really badly of urine - 6th Floor all smells badly. Asked to be changed but was told was too late and alternatives were even worse! - Great customer service NOT. Room service finishes early so make sure you eat before if arriving late. Keys for the room that you have to leave at reception - so out of date. Breakfast very very average but the only saving grace from the rest of the sorry tale. DO NOT STAY HERE. Will ruin your impression of an amazing town.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid, beware”
Reviews.Author: ILZ
Reviews.Content: Travelled to Rome on business trip with several colleagues, our company travel agent pre-booked single rooms for each of us. Because of late arrival (our plane landed around 10:30PM) we asked our travel agent to send a reminder to the hotel on the morning of our arrival that we will show up late and they should keep our rooms. However, when we arrived there, around midnight, the Receprionist apologized and told us that he made a mistake and we are one room short. We ended up with two of us sharing a double room for the first night. The room was VERY small, cramped with furniture. No bath, just a shower with good water pressure. The room is very noisy when the windows is open. Air condition not working. The bed is uncomfortable, and has strange smell (like Lysol). The cover is a cheap old fashined duvet. Breakfast was below standard, cheese, ham, some baked goods, no scambled eggs - just boiled ones, no vegtables. Decent drinks and coffee served to the table. There are better hotels in Rome. I will not return to this one.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly satisfied, will come back again.”
Reviews.Author: Fantomax
Reviews.Content: Came for one night but I could stayed for weeks!!! The room was excellent, no noise, jet the window on the second floor was facing the street side; breakfast was excellent, not too opulent but certainly plenty to eat if you wanted to. Central? are you kidding? It is more than Central! It was magic! in 15 minutes brisk walk you are at Trinita' dei Monti, (Piazza di Spagna) You Pay 100% more if you find a similar hotel in the historic centre. Guaranteed. There is a covered market nearby, Piazza Alessandria: it's a wonder!!! There is the Rinascente Department Store adjacent to the Hotel, Piazza Fiume is a "spring" of Public Transports. Highly recommendable. Enjoy your stay. Leandro Ulisse

Reviews.Title: “Good value, safe and clean - not luxurious”
Reviews.Author: Late_Harvest
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for five nights in August. Size-wise, it's what you expect in Europe - small compact room, but adequate. Room had A/C, bathroom/shower, a safe, and mini fridge and TV. The furniture was dated, and there were signs of wear, but it was clean and safe. Basically all you need to sleep in at night, and to shower in each morning. While the day clerk wasn't overly friendly, he was efficient, and the night manager was friendlier. The continental breakfast was better than most you'll find in North American hotels - juices, coffee/tea, cereals, breads/muffins/bagels with cheeses and spreads - it even had boiled eggs. Location was adequate for the price, you could walk to most of Rome's attraction if you chose - the Vatican was located the farthest - 45 minutes by foot, or better to pay 2€ for 5 minute subway ride. If you stay there, ask for something on one of the higher floors. It wasn't a huge issue - but one night we could hear the late night chat of people out in the rear courtyard even with the window closed. For a value priced hotel - 3 star North American - it did the job well. It was a safe, clean, well situated hotel to sleep and shower in while exploring the city by day.

Reviews.Title: “Not anywhere near a 4 star !!”
Reviews.Author: paulbennett55
Reviews.Content: just back from this hotel. no where near a 4 star . only just a 3 star if lucky. room small and noisy. breakfast ok. staff very helpful. needs a major overhaul !! Paul & Jayne. Wimborne, Dorset.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, Great Location,”
Reviews.Author: Donal66
Reviews.Content: Ideal for what you require in Rome, close to public transport, walking distance of the wonderful Borghese gardens and villa. Staff at the hotel were very helpful organising cabs and explaining directions etc.. Rooms are all fine, extremely clean as is the rest of the hotel. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Horrible !!! Dont bother ruining your stay...”
Reviews.Author: Pink_Diamond_Sparkle
Reviews.Content: Judging by the pictures, one would think this looks like a charming, cute little italian hotel. The pictures were clearly taken from very good angles ! The room was cold, damp smelling and awful. We had a lovely view of bulldozers and big rocks ! The toilet flush did not work and we had to have the staff come up several times to attempt to fix it, that is after they implied that we had something to do with it not working. There were bugs in the bath - which I wouldnt even wash my dog in ! Breakfast consisted only of cold food. The staff were arrogant and unfriendly. The lift up to the rooms sounded as though it was about to collapse and can just about hold 2 people if u dont mind being squashed and sending your luggage up seperatley. This is supposed to be a 4 star hotel ? It is the equivalent of a 1 star in Skegness. We ended up checking into the Hotel Rex in central Rome for the exact same price which was much, much more pleasant. If you are not bothered about comfort or cleanliness, by all means, try this hotel. Otherwise, do not spoil your stay in Italy by using this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay”
Reviews.Author: Anna911
Reviews.Content: This was a lovely hotel with a bit of character. For a tourist room in Europe it was surprisingly large thanks to a somewhat unique room shape. The staff was very helpful and friendly, very typically Roman in my experience. Be polite to them and they will be polite to you. They were happy to point me in any direction that I asked. Breakfast was a decent size Italian-style buffet. Lots of breads, cereal, fruit, nothing hot. The walk from the hotel to the Villa Borghese can be done in about 5 minutes putting the museum, the gardens and numerous eating establishments within easy walking distance. The walk to the Spanish steps took about 25 minutes and you can pick the metro up there to get to the Vatican or Colosseum areas. Bus stops are much closer to the hotel but I never tried them. You can also walk to those areas. The walk to the Vatican took me under an hour and through some pretty parts of town. One warning on this hotel- it is not for anyone that can not handle stairs. When you enter the building you have to walk 10-20 steps down to reach the lobby, and there is no alternative way in that I saw. There are elevators up to the rooms but in my room at least there was a step up into the bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed Our Stay”
Reviews.Author: nico4321
Reviews.Content: Yes, the hotel is basic but we found it to suit our needs just fine. My mother and I stayed here for 2 nights. The location was convenient to via Veneto and the tour we booked for the day. The rooms are smallish and basic, but comfortable. We had a room with a small balcony which was fun. The staff is not as friendly as the american standard is concerned, but I found most people in Rome to be a bit reserved/standoffish. Nonetheless, they were helpful and made our stay comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “A Fine Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DivusIulius
Reviews.Content: Although not comparable with the more opulent four star hotels on the nearby Via Veneto, the Hotel Executive is a perfect base to explore Rome. Certainly the rooms are small, but really, what do you want a big room for? The hotel is removed from the tourist hordes but within easy walking distance of attractions such as the Galleria Borghese and Bernini's statue of St Teresa in SM della Vittoria on via XX Settembre. The neighbourhood is full of agreeable restaurants - il Padovano and la Casa di Alice on via Bergamo, the neapolitan pizzeria on via Piave, and many more besides - so that you can eat very well for very little. A taxi home from the city centre will only cost you about €10, and piazza fiume is well served by buses. As many of these reviews attest, Rome is a minefield of dreadful hotels. Mercifully, the Hotel Executive is not one of them.

Reviews.Title: “Overrated!”
Reviews.Author: Tomnny
Reviews.Content: Hotel may have been nice in the past but not now, paint peeling from walls and ceiling, carpets that may never have been cleaned. Unreliable w-fi service. Surly, unfriendly staff. Location just so-so. Hotwire.com calls this a four star hotel comparable to Hyatt, Marriott and Intercontinental. Not even close! I paid $102 per night for six nights and consider this to be a two star hotel not a four star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value in Rome”
Reviews.Author: N.SURESH
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel not knowing what to expect through hotwire.com. When we arrived we got a room with a small balcony facing the street. The rooms are smaller than what you find in a cruise ship. They are clean and adequate for staying . We paid $ 90 per night for a double room. The breakfast is ok, regular continental style. The elevators are very small just for 2 people. You cant fit your luggage ! The bus stop is close by and conveient to go all over Rome. We got a Roma Pass for Euro 23 which covers unlimited bus rides and enterance to 2 museums of your choice.The hotel is fairly clean and convenient with plenty of buses to the terminii station.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: moggo
Reviews.Content: My husband and stayed for 4 nights in mid February and paid £60 a night for the 2 of us which included breakfast. I considered this to be very good value. Location is just outside central Rome but we enjoyed the walking as it enabled us to see the city in a way you can't when using public transport. The three male receptionists were rather dour.They seemed more interested in searching the internet for budget flights for themselves than seeing to our needs. Room was smallish and a bit on the shabby side but pillowcases were changed daily which impressed me.Room overlooked a building site on which no work was being carried out during our stay. I would not rate this as 4 star hotel, more of a 3star but would use it again at such a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place”
Reviews.Author: roudyclaudie
Reviews.Content: I have stayed several times at this hotel in Rome. I love the fact that it is not in a real "touristy" location. I like the local atmosphere. The rooms are a little on the small side compared to American Hotel rooms, but who cares. In Rome, who sits in their Hotel room? If you do, then you shouldn't be in Rome. The rooms are spotless. The bathrooms are more than adequate. The lobby is very welcoming and the owner and staff are wonderful. They go out of their way to please. There is some construction going on behind the hotel but that can be the case anywhere and in Rome it seems there is always construction of some kind happening. We learned that the construction was held up by the Italian government because they found some "relics" during the digging. They serve a breakfast that is better than anything I have ever had at an American Hotel. Pastries, Yogurt, Eggs, Ham, Juice, cereals, more than I can remember. They also serve very "memorable" American Coffee. I long for it even after I am back at home. Even though the hotel is not in the "center" of Rome, it is easy to get around with the busses only 1/2 block away. The transportation system in Rome is something to be admired. I highly recommend this Hotel. C. Falk , Minnesota USA

Reviews.Title: “Great quiet hotel”
Reviews.Author: Alice22
Reviews.Content: Our room was very comfortable and clean with a good shower. The staff at reception were very friendly and helpful. Although this hotel is not in the centre of Rome we found that this was an advantage because the rooms were very quiet at night. Also, the distance was not a problem because the buses are frequent and run untill midnight. Breakfast was very nice with a good choice and good quality food. I would recommend this hotel to couples or small groups of friends.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mr_MsLhmr
Reviews.Content: When we arrived the hotel by taxi, there was immidiately staff present to take care of our luggage, a friendly, but hardly english spoken eployee that took our cases all the way up to our rooms. That was actually quite necessary, the elevators had hardly room for two people. We were given a room in fourth floor, with a little balcony. Quite tiny, but clean and tidy. A small bathroom, with a tiny showerroom and a bidee(or what it's named) crammed behind the door for some reason. But overall the room was ok, it had a good ecuipped minibar, and the AC worked well in 30 degrees outside. It altso had a digital roomsafe, which wasn't securely mounted though. The neighbour area is a construction site, but noone worked there as long as we stayed. We stayed for 4 days, and the only thing we weren't to happy about, was the very limited breakfast table. There were two somewhat hard types of pastry, eggs, and cheese and ham. Exept that, some types of jam in small portion boxes, and some sereals. After four breakfasts we were kind of tired of egg, ham and cheese..the coffee was fantastic though=) The hotel staff was very serviceminded and helpful, and most of them spoke OK english, by italian standards. For computer nerds, there is a free WiFi zone in the lobby, but for some reason they change the crappy 200 digit WEP hexcode every day(so yesterdays guests can't come back and steal netaccess=) When you want to travel around in the city from the hotel, the easiest way is to buy a metropass (bus, metro, city trains) for three or seven days on one of the metros or Termini. There are many buses to Piazza Fiume (right beside the hotel), or from via Salaria, the street to the right from hotel exit. The yellow bus-signs tells you where the busses stops, so don't go buing an expensive map. You'll get a free tourist map in the lobby, thats all you need. The conclusion is that Hotel Executive has the standards you need if you're going to Rome to see the city. If you're going to have a hotel vacation and stay in your room(why go to Rome then?), watch TV and slumber in a steambath we would recommend other. We payed about E40 pr. person pr. night, witch I think is a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Between 3 and 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dimmah
Reviews.Content: First of all I'll say that I'd booked this hotel at a special promotional rate of, I think £60 a night, so I wasn't going expecting luxury but knowing that I've saved a few quid. For that kind of money I enjoyed my experience there. The hotel is situated in between Castro Pretorio and Spagna metro stops and it is aprox. 15 min. walk to either station. I didn't mind that. It is a 5 min. walk to villa Borghese and the gallery, so you can just drop in and book your time slot there, especially valuable if you're planning on using your roma pass as you can't pre-book on-line without paying. There are a few shops and local restaraunts around the area that are excellent and charge you "local" prices! Now about the hotel itself: the rooms are extremely small, probably the smallest double room I've seen, however, extremely clean. The bathroom was quite large and very clean also. Extremely efficient air-conditioning with various settings that also work! - very important in August! The breakfast is quite good and the staff are very friendly and willing to help! Overall, it is a decent hotel, I'm not quite sure if it rises up to a 4 star criteria, but at least, it is a high 3 star one. So if you don't mind walking and have a chance of saving on your rate, then go there. If you expect luxury and want to look at Colosseum from your hotel window, then it's not a place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Executive - when in Rome ...”
Reviews.Author: EmmaHarrow
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for the very reasonable price of £69 per night ( look around for special offers.) You will be hard pressed to find even a one star hotel for this price anywhere else as it's an expensive city. If you are expecting four star luxury then this is not the hotel for you. However, if you are looking for a spotlessly clean, good value and pretty comfortable place to stay then stay here. Staff were courteous and welcoming during our stay. The rooms are very clean but could do with a lick of paint and are rather compact and bijou. Bathrooms are very modern and we did not have any problems. The breakfasts are fine and we have eaten far worse in Europe! The hotel is a fifteen to twenty minute walk from the Spanish Steps and is not in a touristy area. If you are not very mobile or hate walking then you will struggle, although there is an express local bus which runs into town from near the hotel. Although a way from the centre, this means there are some nice local restaurants around where you can eat real Italian food for great prices without a picture menu in sight. A word of warning - taxis from the Termini train station and where the airport buses stop charge thirty Euros as a flat fee, so you will be paying 45 Euros (about £34) for a five minute ride. If they can rip you off, they will. If you haven't much luggage the hotel is a fifteen minute walk away (bring a map or buy one at station for one euro) or there are loads of buses that travel the mile or so to the hotel. Rome is a gorgeous city, enjoy. When we go back we will certainly consider staying again at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly adequate”
Reviews.Author: CSK38
Reviews.Content: We ended up at this hotel after an online booking agency left us in the lurch by booking us into a place that was already full. I was initially skeptical as the trip advisor reviews were very mixed, but we found it perfectly adequate. The staff were very friendly and helpful (maybe we had different staff to what other reviewers complained about?), and the breakfast was reasonable. The rooms were a bit tired decor-wise, and there is a construction site next door but we didn't hear a peep from them during our stay (it was over the holiday period). We were given the junior suite on the top floor which was very large, so can't really comment on the standard rooms. Not that close to metro stations; about 15 minute walk to the main train station.

Reviews.Title: “Poor choice for the price”
Reviews.Author: bigboroboy
Reviews.Content: To call this a 4 star hotel is a joke. The service (or lack of it), rooms and breakfast are all average at best. The location isn't convinient for anything except the tourist trap of Via Veneto which is still a 15 minute walk alongside a busy road. My laundry was returned wet. The website says that internet access is available in all rooms but it wasn't. It is only available in the cold lobby. I didn't see a single staff member smile once except for when they were crowded around a TV watching a football match once. Not a terrible place but there has to be better.

Reviews.Title: “Not a friendly place”
Reviews.Author: Glendac14
Reviews.Content: This was a surprise trip so couldn't look up the reviews beforehand. It is rated 4* but should be a 2/3*. The staff are not very friendly and look grim most of the time. The room was extremely small but was clean. We overlooked a building site and it was noisy. Had it been a fairly cheap trip we wouldn't have minded but it wasn't!

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: Shmooer
Reviews.Content: Well I was worried about this hotel after reading the reviews as this trip was our Honeymoon. Yes the hotel, rooms & Lift are small BUT it is in a traditional Roman building and those of you who have travelled through Europe before know that these building are normally tall and thin. The service here was excellent and they did everything to make our stay comfortable. The reception was always open and able to answere any quires we had inc local info. We loved the fact that the hotel was not in a tourist infested area which meant we could explore the 'real' side of Rome which perhaps most visitors will never see! If you don't want to walk then you can get a bus very easily from the end of the Road which only costs ONE Euro and is a great way to also see the city! There are at least 4 buses’ which go from by the hotel which can take you to the main Termini Station. Anyway surely it’s more fun to take a walk and see what you discover, lovely restaurants within walking distance. Also my husband and I loved the cute little lifts... very Art Deco!

Reviews.Title: “Just ok”
Reviews.Author: ballymaguigan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Executive hotel this week. We booked with a travel agent and then read the reviews, we were very worried we had made a bad choice.The hotel is out of the city centre a bit but there is a good bus service in.1 euro for a ticket , if you are brave, one ticket would do you for your stay as no one checks.The hotel is clean and tidy ,rooms are small but ok,the lift is small but ok always comes when you press the button.The breakfast is not very good,cheese,ham, hard boiled eggs and rolls,cornflakes a bit strange we brought our own.This hotel is not 4* more like 2* The biggest problem we found were the 2 men at front desk they were as sad as undertakers and were not helpful.I dont think i would stay there again.Rome is not a very clean city , rubbish blowing around everywere,St Peters sq is nice,be careful with the people selling watches and handbags offer them less than half of what they are asking and they will take it. I would not recommend the executive hotel mostly because of the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Not great”
Reviews.Author: shethinks
Reviews.Content: My first visit to Rome, wonderful city and hotel Executive didn't ruin my stay. I managed to make the best of it. First, the hotel is quite far from all atractions (except Villa Borghese). Second, on our arrival, the receptionist told us we had no room for that day because some american tourists decided to stay one more day and they let them stay one more day (even knowing that we'd be with no room at all). No need to say that we immediately demanded to be located somewhere! With a grumpy face, the receptionist made a phone call and told us there was a room for us in the hotel ART DECO and we should return to the Executive the following day. They called the taxi and they paid the ride, it was their mistake not ours. At ART DECO everything was great, location, the room small bur beautiful, the breakfast excellent, and the people who worked there extremely helpful. On the next day, we got to Executive hotel and everything went normal. But getting to our room...it was small, very very small and the view was far from interesting. A tv with some italian channels, bathroom incredibly small. To be honest, the only thing i truly liked was the breakfast, apart from that nothing quite interesting (not to mention the 3 male receptionists who alway seemed to be angry at the entire world). Thank God that Rome is such a beautiful city. That's what made this a really interesting travel (not the hotel or the people who worked there).

Reviews.Title: “Don't go here, forget this hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: thom_vleeskruyer
Reviews.Content: Major building construction works next door! Very (very) small rooms. If you insist, take room 207, at least it's got a reasonable balcony. The flip side of the medal, there are some decent restaurants in the Salaria area. And the Galleria Borghese (10 min walk) is an absolute must!!

Reviews.Title: “Not the greatest......”
Reviews.Author: LondonLondon1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Executive over the Easter holiday. On the web sites I was told that this hotel was 4 star - I've travel often and have stayed in many hotels around the world and would defintely not rate this hotel as four star!! We paid over a hundred pounds a night and I've stayed in far better hotels that cost half that!!For a start it's quite far out, the hotel is small and not at all friendly. The rooms were the worst - absolutely tiny, smelly and not the cleanest! . I booked this room about 5 months before and had requested a room with a park view......on arrival we were given a room with a view of what looked like the bronx! I asked to move and was told that the hotel was full but later found out that the room opposite had been empty for the duration of our stay! The room is so small you could not swing a cat and the bathroom has the smallest shower I've ever seen in my life.... . Rome is a fantastic city and we had a great time.....thankfully we never spent much time in our hotel.......

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, but not close to any sights”
Reviews.Author: auntee9
Reviews.Content: My friend and I booked our trip thru Air France for Rome and Paris. We stayed in Rome first and found this to be a quaint and charming hotel on a side street. It's not for the disabled though as you have to go down stairs from the street to get into the lobby. Our room was very nice and clean. The bathroom looked like it had recently been remodeled. It was large and clean, but there was no shower curtain and it was difficult showering. The continental breakfast every morning was very nice even though they did not have a restaurant in the hotel. The staff were helpful and friendly also. The only problem was that our room was off the street and was quite noisy. Also, here were some nice restaurants and stores in the area, but we were a distance from any main areas or sights. I would definitely recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: ClaireNottingham
Reviews.Content: I arrived, somewhat apprehensively, at the hotel executive having read the previous reviews on this site. However I was pleasantly surprised and generally very pleased with what I found. The hotel was clean and well decorated (admittedly with a bizarre colour scheme in the bedroom). The staff were always polite and helpful to us, although not overly friendly. The rooms were admittedly small with basic furniture, but had everything that we needed, were very clean and the bed extremely comfortable. The bathroom did not contain a bath, but contained a powerful shower and was very clean and well looked after. The lifts are small but we never had a problem with them. The hotel is technically just outside the city centre, and is a fair walk to most of the sites, so you need to go prepared for a lot of walking or use public transport, but we managed to walk everywhere (including the colosseum and vatican) and are not athletic people. The hotel lies just outside the via veneto, and is a comfortable walk away from the piazza de spagna and trevi fountain areas. It is also around a 15 minute walk from the termini train station. Overall we were very happy with our time at the hotel, and it provided everything we needed for a wonderful stay in Rome. We felt it provided value for money, being much cheaper than some other hotels in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Not for first time visitors to Rome”
Reviews.Author: denisenyc
Reviews.Content: This hotel is classified as 4 star but is more like a 2-3 star. It is away from the city center and the front desk is not very helpful (asked them to call us a cab on our way to Termini, but they were never able to get us one---had to schlep our bags there), which is why I wouldn't recommend for a first time visitor. The room itself was tiny but it and the bathroom were clean. Our room overlooked a construction site which was quiet when we arrived on a Friday afternoon. LIttle did I know that when we came back from dinner around 11pm, they would be in full work mode. The window is double-paned, but there is no air conditioning, so you have to leave it open and suffer the noise. I actually liked being in a neighborhood since we got to experience local, not tourist, restaurants and cafes. Used the buses to get around---a little crazy, but once you get the hang of it, they get you where you are going a lot better than the metro. Overall I would not recommend this hotel unless you 1. got a really cheap rate, 2. don't need directions or help getting around, 3. like to stay outside of tourist area

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: MODLAN
Reviews.Content: We werevery disappointed. This is not a 4 star hotel, more like a one or two star hotel Rooms are very basic, cramped and small. Lifts are terrible. Breakfast very mediocre. Staff unhelpful. No bar for residents after 11 p.m. Very unsuitable for disabled. Would never recommend this hotel or stay here again. Also very expensive for the standard of accommodation. A most unpleasant and uncomfortable stay

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly good hotel if you like a walk”
Reviews.Author: KMLondon
Reviews.Content: We booked through lastminute and got a very good deal on this hotel. It's nothing special, but it does the job. It's very clean, breakfast was nice and the staff were friendly. Our room was not very large, nor was the bathroom (shower, no bath) but fine for a short stay. It advertises itself as being close to the Via Veneto, which is in fact about a 15 min walk away so if it's important to you to be very close to the sights then you might want to check a map first. We don't mind walking so it wasn't a problem for us and there is a bus to San Silvestro and also a taxi rank very close to the hotel. I would stay here again if I could get the same rate (about £55 per room per night) but it doesn't have the character, style or extensive facilities that I would associate with a 4*.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Stuart47
Reviews.Content: Booked the hotel through Laterooms.com for a New Year break. Rack rate is very expensive, but then this is Rome. Laterooms prices much more reasonable. Hotel was very clean and the staff were very helpful, all speaking some English. Rooms are on the small side and our original room faced some building works that woke us up at 07:15 on the first morning. We were moved without any problems into a room on the opposite side. Beds are comfortable. Heating is efficient. Lifts are very small, tight squeeze to fit four into one. Breakfast room is small, and cannot seat a lot of customers. But normal continental breakfast, everything is fresh. Good access to the local transport which was excellent. I woudl stay again but not at the rack rate. Not a four star though.

Reviews.Title: “Just and okay hotel”
Reviews.Author: ecc35
Reviews.Content: General: We spent 3 nights in this hotel. I can't hardly say it felt like a 4-star hotel. We were placed in room 103 and I have to say the size of the room was really, really small. However it was clean and felt pretty new. The bathroom was clean but the shower was really small and it leaked a lot of water into the floor when showering. Location: The location is really quiet and kind of tricky to find. We took a cab from Termini since we didn't know the area well. It's kind of out of the way so you'll need to walk or take the bus to most Roman landmarks. The closest metro stop was Barberini--a nice 20 minute walk from the hotel, taking via Piave and later on XX Setembre avenue. Bring good walking shoes or use public transportation. Staff: Helpful and nice. They spoke decent English and tried to help as much as possible. Breakfast: Fresh food and good coffee on demand. Really enjoyed that, especially the fresh assortment of croissants. Miscellaneous: We found a great hotel really close to the hotel where you could find good food for decent prices. If you know some italian or Spanish ask for the Italian menu instead of the English one--it was much more complete and felt more authentic. The staff was bilingual and extremely nice. The name of the restaurant is "Al forno della Soffita". Overall, I'd say it was okay for the 75 euros I paid in lastminute.es. EJCC

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Executive Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Babard
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Executive Hotel for 4 nights and loved it. Yes, it was small, but clean. The bathroom was larger than expected. The shower was large enough and the balcony was nice. Yes, there was a contruction site behind the hotel, but can't really blame the hotel for that. The continental breakfast was excellent. Fresh croissants, sliced ham and cheeses. Fresh fruits and juices. Made to order coffee. We looked forward to this every morning. The hotel staff was excellent and very accommodating plus bilingual. The hotel is situated in a quieter part of town but we appreciated this. There were lots of local great restaurants in this part of the city. Many banks to change money or draw from ATMs. We really enjoyed our stay. The Borghese gardens are just a 5 minute walk. We walked all the way to the Collosseum from the hotel. Bring good walking shoes. The Rinascente department store is just around the corner. We would come back again. Alicia B from Auburn, CA

Reviews.Title: “FInd a different hotel”
Reviews.Author: sweetchariot
Reviews.Content: This Hotel should be classed as 2 star, at best. We stayed in Rome for 3 nights and would not stay at this hotel again. The room we booked had a balcony that over looked a 'garden' - dumping ground to the left and a building site to the right. Workman started at 7am sharp - pile driving!! The room was small and very dirty. With dirty carpets and curtains and the smell was terrible. I didn't trust the lift and used the cleaners back staircase. Breakfast was 2 day old rolls with jam and thimbles of packet fruit juice.

Reviews.Title: “It ain't 4 star”
Reviews.Author: yaberish
Reviews.Content: Definitely not a 4 star hotel. The lift is tiny. The carpet has multiple marks and it stinks. The window can't be closed properly causing noise to enter the room. Breakfast is not generous too. Well, at least the bathroom seems new and clean. Location ain't great but it's easy to catch a bus to most attractions.

Reviews.Title: “more like a 2 star”
Reviews.Author: jessica30
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights here just come back. The hotel is not a 4 star everything about the hotel is small, and cramped. The lift taking us up to our room could hardly get 2 of us in our baggage went seperate. , taking the stairs is the fire escape at the back of the hotel which is dirty and dimly lit and used by the chambermaids as dirty bed linen was piled up on stairs. The room we were given was 303 which was so small and basic., hardly any storage space for clothes, a double bed took up all the room space virtually no tea or coffee or water in room only mini bar with expensive prices.The bathroom was tiny with the smallest shower we have ever seen ok if you are very small and slim absoluty no good if you are not as once in you cannot move turn etc to get showered. Breakfast is set up in the Foyer continental only but fairly good selection to be fair. The hotel is situated quite a way out of the centre 20 mins walk in the financial district not much going on around at night.

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: lorenzo72
Reviews.Content: I liked this hotel. It's in a small street, so very quiet, but just a 1-minute walk from Piazza Fiume and Via Salaria where you can find shops, café (try "Friends" on the opposite side of Piazza Fiume) and good bus connections to Station and city center. The room was very clean and the bathroom was also nice except for the fact that there was no curtain on the tub and it's quite annoying while taking a shower and trying not to "flood" the whole bathroom... Apart from this, everything else was really ok, the staff helpful and very kind and also the breakfast was large and good. I would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “plenty to eat at breakfast”
Reviews.Author: ernerose
Reviews.Content: My Friend and I stayed for 4 nights in March. The Hotel suited us very well. We found the male receptionist very helpful and had our bags brought up to room without asking.The room was very clean,not too big, beds very comfortable and sheets changed every day as were towels in the bathroom, we have no complaints.There was a good display for breakfast anything you needed was there and one could eat as much as one liked. The hotel was welcoming and very clean. As we are two ladies of a certain age prehaps we were a bit far from centre, but we walked in several days and partook a rest at many sights on the way.Took us about 25 mins walking Excellent eating places all around. The gardens nearby are worth a visit.Warning-Beware the taxi from the airport we hardly got out the door of the airport when this charmer with very little english had us in the taxi, i did ask how much but he was driving us on before saying i use meter. we were overcharged, 75euro. The hotel booked the return taxi cost 48 euro so beware! But we had a great time and enjoyed the open top bus,a excellent way of seeing Rome.

Reviews.Title: “no problems!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel was essentially fine. The room was a good size and reception was friendly. Location wise it took us so long to find - no one had heard of it! But when we actually saw where it was we had been walking in circles only 2 mins from it so my advice it to take a map before you go!! Breakfast in the morning was substantial. Like the hotel really; it was good, but nothing spectacular. Hotel Executive is in a nice area, theres a very sweet bar nearby called "friends" which I recommend, also a few minutes walk away are some small little restaurants, pizzerias etc which all seemed to have a lot of lovely character. We had a really great time in Rome and recommend hotel Executive as a good base from which to see everything.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4-star!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We've just got back from Rome where we spent 4 nights at this hotel. Both my husband and I did not like the hotel. First of all, our room was very small and horribly smelly. We couldn't quite work out where the smell was coming from, but it must have been either the carpet (if someone incontinent stayed there before!) or the air conditioning unit. We sprayed the room and used fragnant candles, but still could not get rid of the smell. I agree with the earlier review saying that this hotel (rooms in particular)has no ambience. It should have been given a 3 star rating!

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Executive
HotelInfo.Address: Via Aniene 3 | Piazza Fiume, 00198 Rome, Italy
